decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to assemble the combo of Basking Broodscale and Blade of the Bloodchief to create a powerful engine that generates huge amounts of mana and card advantage. By using cards like Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Command to disrupt the opponent's game plan, this deck aims to control the board while setting up its win condition of overwhelming the opponent with massive creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and Glaring Fleshraker. With the help of cards like Ancient Stirrings and Ugin's Labyrinth, this deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and dominate the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of spells and creatures to create a powerful combo without relying on traditional lands. By using cards like Lotus Bloom and Whir of Invention to ramp up and search for key pieces like Goblin Charbelcher and Thundertrap Trainer, the deck is able to quickly assemble a game-winning board state. Control elements such as Beyeen Veil and Force of Negation help protect the combo, while Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and disruption. Overall, the deck aims to set up a fast and deadly win condition through a unique landless strategy.

This deck utilizes a combination of cycling creatures and cascade spells to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures, then cast Living End to bring them all back onto the battlefield for a powerful board presence. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Force of Negation and Endurance to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By cycling through the deck quickly and efficiently, the player aims to overwhelm their opponent with a flurry of powerful creatures and control spells, ultimately winning the game through sheer card advantage and tempo.

The deck is focused on generating copious amounts of mana in order to cast a large number of spells quickly and efficiently, enabling a powerful combo finish. By utilizing cards like Pyretic Ritual, Desperate Ritual, and Manamorphose to generate mana, and Past in Flames to recur spells from the graveyard, the deck can chain together spells and eventually finish off the opponent with a large Grapeshot. The addition of cards like Ral, Monsoon Mage and Wrenn's Resolve provide additional synergy and consistency to the combo strategy.

This deck focuses on assembling the Allosaurus Combo as quickly and efficiently as possible. The key strategy involves using cards like Neoform and Eldritch Evolution to sacrifice Allosaurus Rider and search for powerful creatures like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant or Griselbrand, allowing for explosive plays and overwhelming the opponent. By utilizing cards like Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer to protect the combo pieces, the deck aims to win the game in a single turn while maintaining control of the board.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on rapidly deploying aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls while using burn spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the board. The deck also leverages powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Joshua, Phoenix's Dominant to generate advantage and close out games quickly. With a mix of efficient threats and disruptive spells, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of speed and versatility, ultimately securing victory through relentless aggression.

This deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive Boros creatures and direct damage spells. The key strategy is to establish a strong board presence early on, using cards like Voice of Victory, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Guide of Souls to apply pressure. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Goblin Bombardment provide additional ways to deal damage and control the board, while cards like Thraben Charm and Static Prison help to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck's goal is to close out the game as quickly as possible before the opponent can stabilize.

This Jeskai Control deck focuses on utilizing a variety of spells to control the board and outvalue the opponent. With spells like Prismatic Ending and Wrath of the Skies for removal, along with card draw and selection tools like Consult the Star Charts and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, the deck aims to maintain control of the game. Thundertrap Trainer and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury serve as win conditions, while cards like Spell Snare and Snapcaster Mage provide additional versatility and interaction. The manabase is carefully crafted to ensure consistent access to all three colors.

Utilizing a mix of artifact ramp, creature recursion, and powerful Eldrazi threats, this deck aims to assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with big creature beats. The strategy revolves around generating mana quickly, protecting key pieces with Boseiju and Cavern of Souls, and disrupting the opponent's strategy with cards like Malevolent Rumble. The end goal is to bring out Emrakul, the Promised End or other massive threats like Glaring Fleshraker and Devourer of Destiny to seal the victory.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying a wide board of artifacts and creature threats, leveraging synergies between artifacts like Mox Opal and Urza's Saga. Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Thought Monitor provide card advantage, while Cranial Plating and Shadowspear enhance the attacking power of the creatures. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Portable Hole and Pithing Needle to control the opponent's board. With a low mana curve and aggressive creatures, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently.

This deck focuses on utilizing instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to bring powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier onto the battlefield quickly. It also includes a package of disruptive instants like Force of Negation and Prismatic Ending to control the game while setting up the combo. The deck aims to efficiently reanimate threats and disrupt opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through powerful creatures and instant spells.

This deck focuses on utilizing Leylines to control the board and pump up creatures, while also utilizing aggressive creatures such as Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu to deal damage quickly. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial to control the game and protect your creatures. With a mix of powerful creatures and control elements, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a rapid victory.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, removal spells, and card advantage. By controlling the board and manipulating the opponent's resources, the deck aims to establish dominance and win through incremental advantage. The deck also includes threats like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to close out the game once it has gained control. The main win condition is to grind out the opponent with efficient spells and resilient threats while maintaining card advantage.

The deck focuses on aggressive play with a mix of disruptive elements to control the opponent's resources. By using a combination of powerful creatures like Overlord of the Balemurk and Emperor of Bones, along with utility cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, the deck aims to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's strategy. The inclusion of cards like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate allows for additional trickery and flexibility in combat. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of efficient threats and disruptive cards.

The key concept of this deck revolves around sacrificing Allosaurus Rider to Eldritch Evolution or Neoform in order to cheat out larger creatures like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant or Griselbrand. Consign to Memory and Disciple of Freyalise provide additional ways to ramp up mana and generate value. The deck also includes cards like Planar Genesis and Generous Ent to further support the combo strategy. The goal is to assemble the pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and game-ending combos. Forest, Island, and various fetch lands provide the necessary mana fixing to support the combo.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Amulet of Vigor and various land cards to generate additional mana and quickly ramp into playing Primeval Titan. The deck aims to assemble key pieces such as Urza's Saga, Simic Growth Chamber, and Lotus Field to set up powerful combos and search for important cards through Summoner's Pact and Tolaria West. By efficiently ramping mana and utilizing Primeval Titan's ability to search for lands, the deck can quickly overwhelm opponents and secure victory through powerful land-based combos and threats like Scapeshift and Aftermath Analyst.
